There should be two tables in the picture, one is a dining table for gathering, and the other is a Haft-Seen table.
One of the most important traditions of Nowruz is setting up the Haft-Seen table with seven items starting with the Persian letter 'S'.
Including wheat sprouts or bean sprouts, apples, vinegar, garlic, gold or silver coins, spices, and maltose.
The Haft-Seen table will also display the Quran and an image of Ali, the founder of Shia Islam.
There will also be mirrors, candles, colored eggs, and goldfish placed on the Haft-Seen table.
People eat a flaky pastry dessert called ‘Baklava’ filled with nuts and honey，which is usually placed in a prominent position.
Source: Nowruz: The Persian New Year and Its Rich Traditions - Persian Learning Center

Wrestling suit
War chariots are usually made of bamboo and wood, and they are quite tall.
The body of the war chariot will be gilded and painted, adorned with various garlands and other decorations.
There will also be a small circular bamboo tray on top of the war chariot, similar to a type of Mexican hat called 'bamo'.
The war chariot is often filled with people.
The chariot is adorned with the statue of the rain god Rato Machindranath.
Source: Rato Machhindranath Jatra: Nepal’s Ancient Rain Festival

Content: The armored vehicle parade will take place on the narrow streets of Patan.
Officials will show the public a gem black vest with a mythological background.(Bhoto Jatra)
Chariots of Rato Machhindranath.
Showing the vest to the crowds on Bhoto Jatra.
Patan Durbar Square
The statue of Rato Machhindranath
Dancers are usually young men.
Source: corroboree - Kids | Britannica Kids | Homework Help

Content: Performers often decorate their bodies with painted markings.
Source: corroboree - Kids | Britannica Kids | Homework Help

Content: Men usually paint their faces with white powder and outline their eyes with circles.
Source: corroboree - Kids | Britannica Kids | Homework Help

Content: They also have long stripes painted on their body and limbs.
Source: corroboree - Kids | Britannica Kids | Homework Help

Content: Indigenous dances often imitate animals or birds.
The dance area is generally a cleared patch of land among the bushes, with a large fire next to it.
Dance is usually accompanied by music, and the elderly will play the didgeridoo.
For safety reasons, the image can be displayed in an animated style.
Source: corroboree - Kids | Britannica Kids | Homework Help

Content: The elderly blow the Didgeridoo.
Pictures of the corroboree dance.
The patterns on the man's face.
On Saint Patrick's Day, it is customary to wear shamrocks, green clothing or green accessories.
The woman may be wearing a hat or headdress decorated with green clover patterns on top.
St. Patrick's Day celebrations are usually held on the streets of Dublin.
There may be festive decorations in the background such as green balloons, ribbons, and shamrock posters.
A common dance during the festival is Irish tap dance.
People's shamrock decoration.
People are tap dancing.
The streets of Dublin, the capital of Ireland
A Swiss man in leather Lederhosen, burgundy vest and black felt hat plays the Alphorn.
Source: Traditional Swiss Clothing: A Short Guide - SwitzerLanding

Content: He leans forward, hands on the horn.
The 3.5m spruce Alphorn has brass clasps and a leather strap with bells.
Foreground: light green meadow with flowers, gray rocks and a leather backpack.
Midground: dark green forests, a gravel path and 3 Swiss chalets.
Background: Matterhorn with glaciers, gradient blue sky and white clouds.
Alphorn
Matterhorn of the Alps.
Tibetan Buddhist monks usually wear red robes.
Source: Sand Mandala Creation with Lama Migmar – Sakya Monastery

Content: The tool they are holding is called 'chak-pur' in Tibetan, which is a long, funnel-shaped metal container.
Source: Sand Mandala Creation with Lama Migmar – Sakya Monastery

Content: Monks wear masks or cover their mouth and nose with cloth while making it.
Source: Sand Mandala Creation with Lama Migmar – Sakya Monastery

Content: There are also various colors of sand arranged beside it.
The sand mandala is generally circular.
chak-pur
Red monk robe
Image reference of the Sand mandala
People usually wear traditional Hanbok.
Men's Hanbok is generally a loose-fitting robe.
Women’s hanbok is brightly colored, with a short top and loose long skirt.
Songpyeon are the most representative food of the Korean Chuseok, and they are a type of rice cake.
On the morning of the Autumn Evening, family members pay respects to their ancestors.
The sacrificial table will be set with food such as rice, rice wine, Songpyeon, red dates, and fresh fruits.
Hanbok
Songpyeon
A picture of a family paying respects to their ancestors.
